events.originalText: Scientists from the Event Horizon Telescope project released the first image of a black hole (depicted), located at the center of the galaxy M87.
events.subtitle: Event Horizon Telescope
events.headline: First image of black hole released by Event Horizon Telescope scientists

events.originalText: First Nagorno-Karabakh War: Dozens of Armenian civilians were massacred in the village of Maraga by Azerbaijani forces.
events.subtitle: First Nagorno-Karabakh War
events.headline: Dozens of Armenian civilians massacred in Maraga during First Nagorno-Karabakh War

events.originalText: In the deadliest aviation accident in Swiss history, Invicta International Airlines Flight 435 crashed into a hillside near Hochwald, killing 108 people of 145 on board.
events.subtitle: Invicta International Airlines Flight 435
events.headline: Invicta International Airlines Flight 435 crashes near Hochwald, killing 108

events.originalText: In the midst of business disagreements with his bandmates, Paul McCartney announced his departure from the Beatles.
events.subtitle: Paul McCartney
events.headline: Paul McCartney announces departure from the Beatles amid business disagreements

events.originalText: The U.S. Navy nuclear submarine USS Thresher (SSN-593) sank with all hands lost during deep-diving tests in the North Atlantic Ocean.
events.subtitle: United States Navy
events.headline: USS Thresher sinks with all hands lost during deep-diving tests in North Atlantic Ocean

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Slovak Jewish prisoners Rudolf Vrba and Alfréd Wetzler escaped from Auschwitz, later publishing a report that became one of the earliest and most detailed descriptions of the camp's mass killings.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Slovak Jewish prisoners escape Auschwitz, publish detailed report on Holocaust mass killings

events.originalText: The novel The Great Gatsby by American author F. Scott Fitzgerald was first published by Scribner's.
events.subtitle: The Great Gatsby
events.headline: The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald first published by Scribner's

events.originalText: Mexican Revolution leader Emiliano Zapata (pictured) was shot to death near Ciudad Ayala, Morelos.
events.subtitle: Mexican Revolution
events.headline: Mexican Revolution leader Emiliano Zapata shot to death near Ciudad Ayala

events.originalText: Big Ben, the bell in the Palace of Westminster's clock tower in London, was cast after the original bell cracked during testing.
events.subtitle: Big Ben
events.headline: Big Ben bell cast after original bell cracks during testing in London

events.originalText: Mount Tambora in Indonesia began the most powerful volcanic eruption in recorded history, killing at least 71,000 people and affecting temperatures worldwide.
events.subtitle: Mount Tambora
events.headline: Mount Tambora eruption kills at least 71,000 people in Indonesia

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: The War of the Fifth Coalition began with the Austrian invasion of Bavaria, then a client state of France.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: War of the Fifth Coalition begins with Austrian invasion of Bavaria

events.originalText: War of the Austrian Succession: Prussian forces defeated Austrian troops at the Battle of Mollwitz in present-day Małujowice, Poland, cementing Frederick II's authority over the newly conquered territory of Silesia.
events.subtitle: War of the Austrian Succession
events.headline: Prussian forces defeat Austrians at Battle of Mollwitz, cementing Frederick II's authority over Silesia

events.originalText: A Mongol army commanded by Tolui captured the city of Merv in present-day Turkmenistan, allegedly killing more than 1.7 million people.
events.subtitle: Mongol Empire
events.headline: Mongol army captures city of Merv, allegedly killing over 1.7 million people
